citances.sentence: 12 On 13 March 2006, Siopis J summarily dismissed the appellant's application relating to his statement of affairs dated 7 October 1991: Macchia v Nilant (Trustee) [2006] FCA 213. Siopis J was satisfied that there was a clear case of an Anshun estoppel: Port of Melbourne Authority v Anshun Pty Ltd [1981] HCA 45 ; (1981) 147 CLR 589. He went on to say that, had it been necessary for him to reach any conclusion in that respect, he would have found that the appellant's substantive application was an abuse of process.

The facts and background to the current application were summarised in just one of many Federal Court proceedings between the parties in Macchia v Nilant (Trustee) [2006] FCA 213 ( Macchia v Nilant 2006 ) where Siopis J relevantly summarised the background material in paragraphs 21-44 as follows:
"21 It is necessary to examine briefly the history of litigation between the parties to understand the context in which the respondent brings his claim for summary dismissal or permanent stay.

BANKRUPTCY ACT 1966 - SECT 54 Bankrupt's statement of affairs
BANKRUPTCY ACT 1966 - SECT 55 Debtor's petition
